intro: Vicia sativa f. leganyana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf vetch, is a perennial legume characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant is notable for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria in its root nodules. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. Its seeds are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines.
